On 06/03/2008, afcarl2 <a.carl@...> wrote:
> In instances of a population being dumped onto a distributed
>  processing enviroment for fitness evaluation, and a random input is
>  required as part of the fitness evaluation, the cited issues come
>  into play above and beyond the NEAT internal random number usage.

Yes I accept that ensuring different RNG seeds across distributed
nodes is critical. This is certainly a very good point, and one I
hadn't considered before when thinking about distributed NEAT.

Regarding using of /dev/random as a seed, I understand this uses
things like timing between key presses, or network packets, that sort
of thing. In the absense of some true RNG hardware this seems liek a
pretty good solution, more info here:

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Entropy_(computing)

Colin.
